website_summaries.verdict: The 4-blade alignment avoids irritation and razor burn while offering a close shave in a unit that includes a useful LED alert system.
pros: The 13,000 cuts per minute motor gives a close shave without leaving any rash or bumps
The LED readout not only tells the current charge level of the razor, but also alerts if the blades need to be oiled or changed
Stainless steel multi-fit Arc4 foil provides a close shave
cons: Long beards may require trimming before use, as the razor may tug slightly on longer hairs

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PARTS - USED - False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: I live in the state of Maryland. I order this product because of the excellent reviews however the product that arrived was far from it. The box appeared to have been very cleverly re-sealed but definitely not new. Inside, there was no AC adapter or headpiece, as seen in the above picture. The actual motor unit was wrapped poorly in plastic that clearly was not done by the manufacturer, as seen in the above picture. Furthermore, the handpiece appears to have already been used based on visible micro-hairs identifiable along along the top, as seen in the picture. I paid over $100 for this product - this kind of practices is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Female Approved and Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Renders a closer shave than Braun Razors and at a fraction of the cost. I use it as a woman for my legs, underarms and bikini area with no problems. I noticed my hair growing back finer and much slower than using Veet. Would recommend and hopefully it lasts for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mz.Evolving

customer_reviews.title: Good shave and decent price, but some annoying quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: — Gives a reliably close shave. Obviously, that’s huge. — It’s comfortable to use. Cons: — It’s loud - about twice as loud as any electric shaver I’ve had over the decades. It could conceivably wake someone sleeping in the next room. — Each time I take off the plastic head cover, the metal top of the shaver pops off, also. Annoying. Maybe there’s a trick and I just haven’t found it yet. So it does its main job admirably. But the loudness would prevent me from buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Loewenthal

customer_reviews.title: Never charged right, forgot about it and missed the return deadline. 1st time I’ve ever been disappointed in Panasonic
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a big buyer of all things Panasonic for many many years. This may be my only let down over the years. Been buying their name brands for over 30 years. This was a gift to my son, for traveling. We would plug it in and get a full read that it was charnged. Use for 30 seconds and it would die. Repeat charging again and again. It should have been returned right then, I own that mistake. He traveled. Forgot about it sitting there in his bathroom and now it’s past the 30 day return period. Waste off a 100 bucks
customer_reviews.author: J.S.R.

customer_reviews.title: Not even as good as older and less expensive Panasonic shavers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shaver 1 month ago to replace my 6 year old Panasonic ES-LT41-K. That shaver was satisfactory for the $75. Not exactly a 1 pass shaver but not bad at all and served me well for 6 years. This newer and more expensive shaver performed poorly in comparison. More passes required to shave the same length of hair, and the flip out trimmer hardly worked at all. Glad for the return policy as I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Chillroom

customer_reviews.title: Great with round things!!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this on my head. It was awesome. Smooth as silk. Shaved dry, no issues at all. Cleaning was a breeze on a sandy coast.
customer_reviews.author: Phill Janzen

customer_reviews.title: Who knew
customer_reviews.text: I have using a competitors rotary style shaver for years and years until I decided to try this razor...I gave the rotary razors to charity. Not only do I get a closer shave but a quicker one too. I always had trouble before getting the fine hairs on my throat with my previous razor but not with this. Takes me half or less time to shave with this razor and I have less skin irritation by not having to go over the same area so many times. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R H

customer_reviews.title: Better shave than Norelco
customer_reviews.text: Have been a norelco shaver user for about 40 years, having bought at least a dozen over the years. About 6 months ago I noticed I was no longer getting even a rather poor shave anymore. Tried new blades. No difference. Just used my new Panasonic shaver. MUCH better shave. The construction of the Norelco and its blades appears to be same as always. Must be my beard and/or skin changing. But the Panasonic is much noisier than the Norelco. I’ll get used to it. Just noticed Panasonic replacement blades Much less expensive than Norelco, if that is important to anyone
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Pell

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I could have bought something better for that price. It broke down after a couple months
customer_reviews.author: Dennis white

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great razor when I first got it, but in less than 3 months it stopped working. I'm not hard on stuff, things I buy tend to last a long time. I usually only replace razors after multiple years when the built-in rechargable batterie's won't hold a charge anymore. This Panasonic was never dropped, hit or handled roughly. Yet now when I push the on button it hums loudly but the razor doesn't move, like the internal mechanism is broken. Tried everything and it simply won't work anymore. Worthless. This was my first and last Panasonic. I highly recommend you choose a different, better brand.
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: If you need this for a beard or mustache this is a terrible shaver/trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: I have a beard and the beard trimmer on this is completely useless. It is designed so that you cannot see what you're trimming (unless all you're doing is trimming sideburns). If you are trying to trim the front of a beard or mustache, the trimmer is not at all visible. You may as well close your eyes and pray. I will be junking this and going back to the Norelco which served me well for years. I guess it was my fault for trying something new.
customer_reviews.author: Another Opinion

customer_reviews.title: It's a good, but not great shaver
customer_reviews.text: Having used a Norelco for 20+ years I had grown accustomed to having to only make two passes across my face to get an even shave. With the Panasonic I have to make four or five, but the shave is noticeably closer than I was able to get with the Norelco. Also, the width of the head makes it difficult to get into the tight areas around my nose. But as I said, it is the closest shave I have gotten from an electric shaver. I do not use it wet and I clean the shaver head every other day.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nordstrom

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Battery, Very Difficult Dealing with Panasonic.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great shaver UNTIL 3 the shaver was 3 months old, and then one day it quit working. Panasonic wants me to return it (on my dime), then they'll either fix or replace it, and get it back with me who knows when. In the meantime, shaving needs to go on every day, and a manual razor is not an option. This was much too expensive a shaver to quit after 3 months. Unacceptable. The good news is that AMAZON came through for me!
customer_reviews.author: Debia M

customer_reviews.title: Best Shaver I've Bought
customer_reviews.text: This Arc 4 is a great razor and i have the Arc 5, Norelco 8900 and used to use a Braun. Save your money and buy the Ar 4 instead of those other models. The shaving head is at lest 1/4 inch smaller than the Arc 5 and makes it easier to move around when you shave. The 5 is a good shaver but to me not worth the extra money for the same exact shave and a more comfortable because the head moves around easier then the more expense 5 shave. Save your money and get the Arc 4 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Big Guy

customer_reviews.title: Said he uses it in the shower and cuts great! So if course I'm thinking pricy but when ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to shave for work and a regular razor has been cutting my skin up more recently. A buddy of mine purchased this and was telling me about it. Said he uses it in the shower and cuts great! So if course I'm thinking pricy but when he sent me the link you couldn't go wrong for the price! Got it last week and it has been cutting great even on the first shave! I couldn't be happier with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Lasted an hour
customer_reviews.text: Instead of buying a women’s electric razor, i decided to buy a men’s. Every time i buy something online, i look at the reviews - i thought this was going to work really well. As soon as the razor came in, I charged it to 90% and used it on my legs.. it worked great at first then when the battery got down to 20% (battery life sucks) the razor stopped cutting. I cleaned it like the paper said and charged it a little more... once again it wasn’t cutting. My boyfriend used the trim feature and it worked for a little while and started making a strange noise.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Best Change I Ever Made!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a rotary electric shaver user for years. Lately, the shaves just didn't seem close enough, no matter how many times I would go over the same area. I checked out reviews of "best electric shavers" and the Arc4 was in the top 10 list. The price on Amazon was also great. Well, I have been using this shaver for about a month. Shaving now is faster and the shaves are the closest ever! No comparison to the rotary blade. This shaver ever shows you how long you shaved, the percent of battery usage, and how much battery is charged. Even cleaning is much easier than the rotary type.
customer_reviews.author: FB

customer_reviews.title: Needs more power.
customer_reviews.text: Glides over smoothly, but I find the power weak. Will get the job done, but you have to keep going over the shaving area. Not as powerful as a Remington, but it is quieter, maybe because it needs More POWER. Cannot plug in power cord while shaving for more outlet wall power. Has to be unplugged from wall in usage.
customer_reviews.author: 100% DOMINANCE PROMINENCE

customer_reviews.title: This Razor is AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing battle with razors of one type or another for over 60 years. I have tender skin and a tough beard. I've tried a variety of electric razors in the search for the holy grail, the perfect razor. This week, Amazon somehow managed to get me this razor the day I ordered it and I still can't figure out how they did it. The razor is beautiful to look at, comfortable to hold and has given me unbelievably close shaves without burning my face a bit. If you are looking for a great razor, spend the money and get this Panasonic beauty. You are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Good razor
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this razor. I am almost 70yr old and I'm still looking for a good shave. I hate to shave but don't want a beard or have to get a new wife so this razor works for me. It is a little smoother if you use it wet but it is tolerable to use dry. I have tried electrics before but was not pleased with the results. This Panasonic works well and I can use it anywhere. I can get 90% shaved anywhere and only have to finish with a razor in the bathroom. It is easy to clean and runs for two or three shaves before the need to recharge which it does quickly.
customer_reviews.author: C.W.

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Electric Shavers has Been my Got for Years
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mind recently asked for a recommendation on a good electric shaver. Without hesitation, I recommended the Panasonic electric shaver. He ordered the ES8243A. After one use, he is a believer and now he is reeommending to his pals in his neighborhood. (And I am sure, they all ordered theirs from Amazon.) So when my Panasonic electric shaver of 11 years was finally not holding a charge, I ordered the ES8243A as well. As expected, this new electric shaver is wonderful. Shaves close. Cleans very well especially after a periodic rinse with foaming soap. And btw, it comes with a really nice zippered travel case - great for travelling! I highly recommend this shaver. And reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Peep

customer_reviews.title: This is much better than the Norelco
customer_reviews.text: I've used Norelco for the last 30 years but I wanted to give the foil shavers a try. This is much better than the Norelco. Shaves closer and with far fewer passes. Battery life seems a little shorter than what I'm used to, but the quality of shave is excellent. We'll see how it stacks up as far as durability.
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: Done with razors
customer_reviews.text: Been a razor man for years. Decided to try an electric. Was skeptical. Best thing i ever did. This little electric shaves as close as any razor i ever used and shaving time cut in half. Great little electric easy clean, close smooth shave evenbon two day growth great price long charge life. Highly recomended
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Cunha

customer_reviews.title: Good electric razor for the price
customer_reviews.text: With the newer version out, this is a pretty fair price for this product. Ultimately, I ended up returning it for the simple fact that it just isn't necessary for me with a full beard. Using this on my neckline alone doesn't make sense. I'd say this is a good purchase for someone who is clean shaven. Does it give you the equivalent to a razor shave? No, of course not, but I'd say it's pretty close, and certainly one of the best for an electric razor. I know some people who only use electric razors and never use an actual razor blade. For me, ultimately, I couldn't justify the price for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not my cup of tea
customer_reviews.text: I recently had facial surgery and have been unable to shave with my razor. I thought an electric shaver would solve my problem. After reading many reviews on many of the electric shavers,I settled on this one.Ergonomically and aesthetically this shaver is a home run. However once I shaved with it ,I was disappointed. Maybe I am just used to a blade shave but this shaver did not give a good shave at all.I'll wait awhile and go back to my blade shaver. It may work for you but just not my cup of tea!
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Robin

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my grey beard.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a similar ten year old Panasonic shaver that was taking longer to shave than with a blade. This unit shaves great - I can get my face silky smooth in under two minutes. It's much quieter than my old one, and the battery life is excellent - I haven't had to recharge it yet in almost two weeks after daily use. It's comfortable to use and super easy to clean. Seems to be a great value. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: GDurb

customer_reviews.title: Best shaver delivers a close shave
customer_reviews.text: By far the best razor and you can say that for just about everyone of Panasonic's razors I've used many of them over the years and they're just I just wish you could change the batteries when they become worn out and I wish also that parts were easier to get the plastic parts that will move the razors in the shaver had once they start getting loose that's when this razor becomes less effective Considering what blades cost this shaver will last for years the last one of these I had is over 6 years old and I still using it it just requires me to charge it more frequently it makes a good backup
customer_reviews.author: Lion

customer_reviews.title: 10 years and still going!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver more than 10 years ago and it is still going strong! I've replaced the blades and screens several times but that is it. It still works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Clean, close shave, integrated trimmer & reasonable $$ a real plus
customer_reviews.text: I have been a loyal Philips/Norelco user for decades. Became a little disappointed with the recent Norelco interchangeable head design. Needing to pack a separate trimmer head is a chore, particularly without real space for in the carrying case. Not with this Panasonic Arc4. It has the integrated trimmer, decent battery life, quiet motor; excellent close shave wet or dry. Best of all, comparable performance to the Norelco ($200) shaver, much more convenient, and for less than 1/2 the price. I Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: H Vu

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended due to HORRIBLE battery/life and I STILL have to use a regular razor for my neck!
customer_reviews.text: This shaver still leaves pesky neck stubble so I have to also use a razor blade. It’s VERY noisy. The reviews were glowing when I first researched this product but it hasn’t lived up to those reviews. The WORST thing about this shaver is the battery/charge life! I get only a few days shaves out of it before it’s totally dead. I’ve watched it go from 100% to 60% in one day with a morning shave and then a touch up afternoon shave. Terrible! Going to look at Norelco and others or just go back to regular razors.
customer_reviews.author: Kenstrodamus

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an electric razor that pleased my very picky Dad!!!
customer_reviews.text: He has always used a safety razor because his beard is so heavy. We tried umpteen electric razors and he hated every one. Recently he took a terrible fall and broke some ribs, which meant he was unable to shave himself. His caregiver suggested this razor so we decided to give it a try. He is 87 with moderate dementia and anything new is difficult to accept. To be honest we figured he would refuse to even try it out, except that he didn’t have a choice. He absolutely loves it!! Says it does a better job than his trusty safety razor. 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Htgmama

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick curly hair
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool electric razor. The blades move with the contours of the face. It's easy to clean and it's rechargeable. It also comes with a little travel bag. This would probably be perfect for anyone with soft straight hair. Unfortunately, my husband has course curly hair so this did not work well for him at all. After the first or second shave his face was covered with bumps and ingrowns. In some places the shave would be extremely close and in other spots it wouldn't catch the hairs at all. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Shaver stopped working for no reason
customer_reviews.text: I'm about 6 months into owning this shaver. I don't shave often and take good care of what I own, cleaning it regularly, etc. However, this shaver just stopped working. It's full charged and there's no damage to the unit. Still, it won't turn on. I tried all the standard things to see if there was something on my end that I missed. Nope, the shaver is just dead. For such an expensive shaver, I obviously expected this to last pretty much forever. 10 years maybe, at least? Customer service charging me shipping and liability for damage in transit. Very disappointed and will be going with different brands in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Best razor I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: I had the 3 blade version of this for a number of years and it was loud compared to this one. This one is much quieter and shaves very nicely. I do use Williams Lectric Shave as I have for years and it works well. Thanks to the other reviewers here that pointed out they liked this one better than the 5 blade because as wide as the head on this, I don't think the wider 5 blade would of worked as well for me. I've had this for a couple of months now and am very happy with it. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Z

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality, Mediocre Shave
customer_reviews.text: This is the most expensive razor I have ever used. It seems to be well built. The led display is clear and easy to read. It charges quickly. It is nice to be able to shave wet or dry, and to be able to wash it without worrying about ruining the razor. However, the shave really isn't that great. It isn't super close, and it has irritated my skin a number of times. The shave quality is pretty comparable to the about $30 Remington I was using the past few years. Thankfully I got this on sale at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: BKKL

customer_reviews.title: Absolute waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver because I thought if I spend a bit of extra money then surely it will be good right? And it had so many good reviews too. Well I am certain most of these reviews are fake because this shaver does not work properly. I tried it without shaving cream and with shaving cream and it takes FOREVER to finish shaving--leaving patches everywhere. I also tried it on my head and this was next to impossible to do. It took almost an hour and by that time the battery ran out and I was left with patches on the back of my head because it does not shave properly. Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Jones

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Buyer, like Panasonic Better than Other Brands
customer_reviews.text: Only have had it a week seems as good as the last one of a comparable size, it either charges faster, or has a smaller battery than my last one, but other than that is great! Seems to cut my beard closer than the competitors, and doesn’t pull as much on the longer whiskers.
customer_reviews.author: DaveC

customer_reviews.title: Glad I switched to this razor
customer_reviews.text: I have used Norelco razors for several decades but didn’t feel they gave me as close a shave as I wanted. I tried a Braun but it was too loud for me. After studying Amazon reviews for this Panasonic model recently, I decided to give it a try. The instructions say to give your skin a month to get used to it. That is good advice. At first it was a little rough on my skin, but after a few weeks my skin got used to it. The razor is a little louder than my Norelcos but not so much so as to bother me. And it does give a closer shave. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Awesome razor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I settle on this razor. I was not going to pay I spend some time researching razors before buying this one. I was not going to spend I spend some time researching razors before buying this one. I was not going to pay $300 for a razor. I have been using Norelco for years. I will never go back. This razor gives a nice, close shave and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing performance, worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: Used Braun shavers for forty plus years. Also used Remington, Phillishave, Schick. This Panasonic although not top of their line, puts all the others to shame. My one regret is that I did not get this brand earlier! It is smooth, fast, efficient, the battery performance is excellent. I have had it for two months; and if the cutter heads last even half as long as the Brauns do; I have a winner. No regrets whatsoever. PS: I use it 'dry'.
customer_reviews.author: zeegee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance Shaver!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after going through about a dozen shavers - (a couple of Norelcos, basic Remingtons, a basic Braun, and several cheap rotary style shavers). Fed up with mediocre performance I actually read reviews and spent time shopping for this shaver. I love it! Wet or dry, I’m happy with it! I maintain a beard and moustache so close shaving is limited to just my neck and a few areas on my face, which means i’m done shaving with the Panasonic in only a minute or two. I do need to use a seperate beard trimmer but thats to be expected. My wife says it works great too, I just told her I don’t want to hear about that..
customer_reviews.author: Flatwound

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve ever used to shave my head
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Braun shavers for 25 years. No more. This shaver is fantastic. I use it to shave my entire head as well as my face. It shaves very close to the skin, but doesn’t irritate your skin at all. I don’t use shaving cream, but it’s nice to know that is an option with this wet/dry shaver. With its supersonic mode it cleans easily and quickly. They also include a travel bag. I’m quite confident I’ll be buying these for the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: J. Terrence Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Best In Class
customer_reviews.text: What a surprise! This shaver is better than models costing three times more! It takes a bit longer to shave my scalp versus a traditional razor blade, but the end result is 95% as good. No electric shaver has ever been as close as a blade, but this one is darn near the same, and if used as a wet shaver, then it’s 99% as good! Tip: For optimal results keep perpendicular and give your scalp about a month to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well at all
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't shave my thick beard off period. I tried using this on my thick beard and both the beard trimmer and the side burn trimmer didn't get a single piece of hair, i specifically the shaver to shave my beard and it doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge time-saver!!! Smooth shave.
customer_reviews.text: I love this shaver! I can get a smooth shave when dry without having to get in the shower, and I save a lot of time in the shower because I'm not shaving in there anymore. The shaver does a great job getting everything with 1 or 2 passes over a given area. I have very sensitive skin and haven't had any irritation with this, although I do immediately apply a good moisturizer afterward, which I'm sure helps. Used on legs, armpits, bikini area.
customer_reviews.author: LeonaG

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to a rotary shaver again!
customer_reviews.text: I spent most of my life as a blade shaver, then transitioned to electric in my "later" years, mainly for convenience. I do not have a heavy beard, but I was never thrilled with the results of my various rotary shavers, and finally decided to spend the extra $$$ and try this one. WOW!- am I ever glad I did! Although not quite as close as a blade, this shaver leaves my face smooth and soft. Shaving now isn't a "chore", but a pleasure. Give it a try, Gents.
customer_reviews.author: JK-James L. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this just a few weeks ago. My husband has sensitive skin! Keeps punching his skin. Had to stop using it. Since he used it, probably can’t return. What a waste of $100. Especially during these difficult times
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Noisy
customer_reviews.text: The razor shrieks like a banshee. Shaving my cheeks and getting the razor close to my ears is torturous. It shaves great and is comfortable to handle, but the extreme noise makes it very hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ed G

customer_reviews.title: Pretty close shave
customer_reviews.text: So not the first time buying an electric shaver, had a Norelco for about 5 years which was pretty good but broke. This Panasonic gives me a closer shave but is a bit louder (don't mind because of the closer shave). I also don't have to buy the cleaning liquid as you can just clean it under a faucet. I have just used it 3 times now but so far so good. I'll update in a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: DaBears!

customer_reviews.title: It's Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned anything this poor in my life. You can shave for 15 minutes and look like an idiot.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Burrows

customer_reviews.title: Had on 10 yrs and still going strong...buying 2 more for my sons
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor over 10 years ago and it still works great. My twin 5yr old boys at the time are now 16 and they are both getting one each for Xmas as they have been sharing mine for the last year. I am ecstatic this model is still being sold. I can't think of any product that I have used daily for 10 years that still works great. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Musumeci

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down Best Shaver I’ve Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many shavers over my life, and this one is by far the best! I had finally gone back to a manual razor a few years ago after being so disappointed with various electric ones I had tried. But, I reviewed an article describing the pros & cons of many electrics based on beard type and decided to give this a try. All I’ll say is that I’m extremely satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye Braun
customer_reviews.text: Had a Braun for years until battery finaly went. New Braun was in the shop 3 times under warranty in which they appeared to not have a problem with, gave it away under warranty and most defiantly traded up for the Panasonic. Fits in your hand better and gives a lot closer shave.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Misleading advertisement!! It has 2 moving blades and I guess the head of the shaver with the foil is considered the other 2 blades. Very disappointing to be that blatant & misleading. That said, the shaver works very well. Good clean shave. Very quiet. Good shavings collection. I usually shave while driving to work. Almost all shavings stay in the housing, not on my shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, comfortable, shave.
customer_reviews.text: Love this electric shaver! I had a Norelco before. One with those three cutting heads that spin. My beard is whack and grows three directions. So I have to shave up down and side to side. The Norelco woul burn my neck bad if I pressed down at all. This razor just won’t burn no matter how hard I push. Only had it a few weeks so I’ll re-visit in six months and update my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Ledgerwood

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: After owning this for a few weeks, I feel this electric razor was well worth the expense. The shave is pretty comparable to that of a razor and I feel pretty smooth afterwards. Using in the shower with shaving cream provides the best results with my stubble. The only area I’ve had any mediocre results is on my neck, but I can usually touch up those missed areas with a few more passes. Cleaning this razor is really easy: a little liquid soap and water. I don’t feel the cleaning system offers much ROI and adds significant cost to the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J Cake III

customer_reviews.title: It's really great - very close shave
customer_reviews.text: This is the razor you're looking for. You might think all of these are created equal but that's not true. After years of using the low end Norelco (with the round blades) and basically hating I finally gave in and bought this one. It's really great - very close shave, efficient. My only complaint is that it's very loud, but I can live with it. We'll see how it holds up but so far I'm really liking this.
customer_reviews.author: central squared

customer_reviews.title: Talked my Husband into using an electric one again
customer_reviews.text: Hubby had major neck surgery and was trying to figure out how he is going to shave since he is stuck in a neck brace for 6-12 weeks.. He is a die hard foam and razor shaver, so I had to sell him on trying an electric razor. He was extremely surprised how easy it worked and what a great shave he had. This is easy to clean and charges fast.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard50

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic shavers are always best
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Panasonic shaver and its grade is second highest ever. I used to own a more expensive Philips shaver but this one is much better than it. Panasonic shavers never irritate my skin unlike other brands I owned (Philips, Braun) and their fast moving blades are very comfortable. I own a more expensive model with five blades but this four blade model is still good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hiroshi Nishida

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday shaver
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have an exceptionally heavy beard, this shaver will keep you neat for a full workday. The head comes off easily for cleaning, which can take place under the faucet, and the charge is good for about a week's worth of shaving. So far so good, but have only had it since Christmas, so jury still our on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Frank DLT

customer_reviews.title: Shaves close
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've taken the time to review an item--why this time? This shaver is awesome.I've used a norelco rotary my whole life and decided to try a foil.The replacement heads for norelco were about what I paid for the razor new. This panasonic feels very light and compact in your hand, The closest shave I have had maybe ever. Where on the norelco I would have to go over each area 4-5 times, this razor once or twice--smooth. AND a screen showing time left and percentage of charge left. Truthfully I don't have the thickest beard, but for me 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: john k.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for tougher beards
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my previous Panasonic wet/dry razor (ES-RT51) and couldn't be happier. I have been using it several times a week for over a year and have had great results. The extra RPMs have gone a long way in helping tame a very tough beard. It charges quickly and as with my previous Panasonic, doesn't get any 'slower' just because the battery is running low.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Elliott

customer_reviews.title: I loved it in 30 seconds
customer_reviews.text: The instructions and some other commenters have said to give this razor 30 days. I loved it in 30 seconds. Quick, smooth shave the first time I used it. Very comfortable. No razor burn or redness. And, that's with a dry shave. It's probably been 20+ years since I shaved with an electric razor, but I don't see me going back any time soon. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Roy B.

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!  A close shave without a burn
customer_reviews.text: Been through 4-5 razors over the last few years in the $30-$50 price range. They all left my neck incredible irritated. I used them each for months “to let the skin get sued to the razor” with no improvement. Right out of the box I got a close shave with ZERO razor burn/irritation/skin reddening/discomfort. Alas, I have found my new razor for life!
customer_reviews.author: J. Russell

customer_reviews.title: YOU WON'T GO WRONG WITH THIS Panasonic SHAVER.
customer_reviews.text: This shaver is the best I'v owned in a long time. It does give me the best shave. My face feels like it was done with a blade. Cleaning is also a simple task. I highly recomend giving it a try. This Panasonic Arc 4 walks all over the last shaver I purchased from Amazon. It's for sure a good buy. JJR. OC. Ca.
customer_reviews.author: JJStryyker

customer_reviews.title: Good Perofrmance
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with my old Panasonic for around 20 years and thought no shaver could be better than this loyal shaver could be. Yet the battery finally became too weak beyond reasonable expectation. To my surprise this new version is even better on shaving. Well - for another 20+ years to go? Very likely.
customer_reviews.author: Sunmoon

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Very good, leaves a fine growth that's removed with a blade easily. You can get a closer shave... for $400. This is my 3rd Panasonic in 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: David Pagel

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Razor!
customer_reviews.text: Best razor ever! Holds charge long time. I get about 15 shaves on a full charge. It tells you how much battery is left by percentage. Charges in about an hour! I've had it for a little over a year and it's still sharp! Much faster than my old foil razor. These people put extra effort into the quality of this razor as it is an amazing product. Easy to clean too as the cover just pops off with the press of a button.
customer_reviews.author: amzn_mbr_2621

customer_reviews.title: Great electric shaver.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor in 2010 and here we are at 2015 and it is shaving as good today as 5 years ago. I've not replaced anything. Now though, it is down to about 3 shaves (at 2.5 minutes per shave) before needing a charge. I love it and don't see a better shaver out there so I'm about to buy it again. Some of the pretty blue paint is showing wear in spots, but so am I so we fit together (I'm 71) and it still shaves as close and quickly as it used to. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald G.

customer_reviews.title: Great razor but short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I've used electric shavers for 30 years and this Panasonic gives me the best shave of any one I have ever owned. The LED display is great. The size of the unit is great, it is actually pretty small so it doesn't take up much room in my toiletry bag, The only reason I give it four stars is that the battery life is pretty short. I've had some razors they could go two or more weeks between chargers, and that was with every day use. I've owned the Panasonic for about a month and I'm only getting about a week between charges.
customer_reviews.author: sbrad

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: You have to be patient with it this is my first time to use this kind of shaver it was horrible at the first time and I was going to return it back but there is a note inside the box says if it’s your first time you have to wait 30 days until your skin get used to it so I trust Panasonic so I wait and I gotta tell you it’s shave like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Hossam Zomorodi

customer_reviews.title: No more razor blades to me.Beats
customer_reviews.text: Beats the heck out a razor and is just as close. You can use it with soap or lotion, wet or dry. Doesn't irritate, does the job. Plus it has a smaller carbon footprint than blades.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this shaver 5 times, but I really like the smooth save it gives me. Much better than the rotary blade razor I have been using. I will update this 5 star rating if I find any issues. The case is soft sided and might not be the best for travel, but NBD to me. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: STEVE WOOLDRIDGE

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using electric razors for 11 years now. This one is by far the best I've used. Beats Braun, Remington, and Phillips in terms of quality, efficiency, and closeness of shave. I was tentative to purchase because it is more expensive than some models, but I'm happy to say that it's money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with such a name brand product, Extremely noisy, I've never had a razor this loud. Battery life, about 18 to 20 minutes, always having to charge. Easy to clean. Overall after a few months use, it now resides in the trash can. Just bought a 6 series Braun, my first-well worth the $100., unlike this Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Two favorite shavers -- one new and one not-so-new.
customer_reviews.text: The Gillette Company's 196_ (?) World Series TV adds for their new Track-II razors influenced me to give it a try. Over the years I've tested newer razors and shavers, but after trying them out none of them were what I was looking for. Then I tried the Panasonic; my new shaver.
customer_reviews.author: westcoaz

customer_reviews.title: Best razor, over and over again!
customer_reviews.text: Light, quiet and close. I’ve always had the best experience with an electric razor with a Panasonic. And being a woman and using it to shave my mile long legs, I’m really asking a lot from a razor. The other men’s razors are good as well as far as shaving, but never last as long. And for the women’s razors, they’re crap! Every one of them. They need to take a clue from the boys.
customer_reviews.author: angie jones

customer_reviews.title: The greatest shave ever
customer_reviews.text: Do to a medical condition and treatments I’m undergoing I was told I could not use my Dollar Shave razors during treatment. I had to use an electric razor. Using electric razors in the past I was not happy about this, but, I have to follow Doctors orders. I researched electric razors and found the Panasonic razor had really good reviews. After trying the Panasonic razor for the first time I was sold. It’s easy to use, its easy to clean and the shave is close and afterwards my face is smooth. It’s worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made quiet shaver. The only thing that I don't like about it is that it doesn't shave nearly as close as my old Remington foil shaver and it takes me twice as long to shave and it's that's not even close to my old razor. I would have returned it if I hadn't waited until after the 30 day return window. If your not concerned about a close shave then I would recommend this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Seems very well made and the adjusting shock system on the head is amazing. But it just couldn't cut the hair on ...
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning this. Seems very well made and the adjusting shock system on the head is amazing. But it just couldn't cut the hair on my neck very well without taking a lot of time and multiple passes.
customer_reviews.author: DadOfMax

customer_reviews.title: Close shave, noisy, low battery life
customer_reviews.text: I use this razor to shave my head and my face. I had formerly bought a cheap one and there were no replacement blades offered for it so I went for this. This razor provides a closer shave which is nice however is annoyingly noisy and I get about two and a half shaved before it needs recharged. With the cheap one I had before I got eight before it needed a recharged. It's disappointing that a razor at this price has an inferior battery to a razor half the price.
customer_reviews.author: somedude

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Brother bought this shaver and told me about it. I was skeptical because I can never find an electric shaver that gets those stubborn neck whiskers, but this shaver does the trick. Easy to clean and easy to use. My only concern was the fact I didn't have to keep going over an area over and over again, so getting accustomed to its efficiency was a learning curve. Battery life is great, last five days of close shaves. Well worth the $130 or so bucks you spend. Love this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Norelco and Braun razors n the past and thought that my Braun could not be beat, but didn’t want to spend that much for something that I didn’t think I wouldn’t use often. My wife bought this for me and it is so nice I use it almost every day!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Alden

customer_reviews.title: Superior comfort
customer_reviews.text: I should have replaced my Norelco a long time ago! I kept replacing the blades hoping it would improve but the Panasonic is just a better design. Smoother, much less irritating and I have used it both wet and dry with excellent results. If you are on the fence about trying this, go ahead!
customer_reviews.author: Paradox Advisors.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! High quality item and extremely easy on the skin
customer_reviews.text: Works great! No sensitivity and not cuts. It works better than the rotary name brand that i have used. Will buy again when needed. I would recommend to anyone needing a good shaver. It works extremely well and the high rating is well deserved by this item. Easy to clean. Just rinse and add drop of soap, turn on, wait..... rinse and done! Update: 03-2020 Works to this day and only replaced blades once. Incredible machines this is. Panasonic has done a wonderful job in quality.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good razor
customer_reviews.text: I've used all the Arc4 razors from Panasonic and for my face this one is the best. A little pricey but shaves close.
customer_reviews.author: SWGeek

customer_reviews.title: best electronic razor i have used!
customer_reviews.text: smaller, easier to use, and much better than the Philllip one. feel sorry did not buy it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Panasonic ES8243A now for a full year of fast, flawless shaving. I must admit I don't get the advantage of using an electric razor in water so can't vouch for that experience. I have the top-line Norelco and had the top-line Braun, but neither has anything on this Panasonic. (Even though this device shaves faster and as close and the best out there, (I still use a five-blade water-and-foam shaving system for the closest possible shave.) One caution: the replacement shaving heads (annually) will set you back $40-$50, depending where you buy. But if a close, quick electric shave is what you seek, you won't be disappointed here.
customer_reviews.author: Phlabberghast!

customer_reviews.title: It tells you how much battery life is left
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have no complaints about the razor. It easily follows the contours of my face. I haven't traveled with it so no comment there, but I don;t forsee a problem. As the title says, when you finish shaving and turn it off it tells you how much battery life is left. It also tells you how long you shaved.??? Ok.
customer_reviews.author: malarky1

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old one of the same brand that lasted for 8 years! This is a great shaver and works well. It gives my a close shave. Just make sure you clean it well when it tells you to and change the blades when it tells you to.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Helveston

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a big mess
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this shaver is phenomenal except one thing. The shaver does not hold in the hairs. You will literally be covered in microscopic hair particles. I am surprised most people don't mention this. It gets all over your face, chest, clothes, floor, etc. So if you shower first, then shave, then you would have to shower again. I use it primarily to shave my head. After 3 uses, it is quite annoying. I have to shower, shave, shower, look to see if I missed any hairs, shave again if needed, shower, and done. 2-3 showers per use. Strange
customer_reviews.author: James D

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I should have returned this shaver but waited too long. It's the worst shaver my husband has ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jury still out on it....it works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a four year old Panasonic that had lost the ability to recharge. I lived that model, and how closely it shaved my face and worked around the contours of my face and neck. While I am still getting used to this one, I feel like it doesn't do as good of a job on the contours of my neck. Every function works well, and the razor works fine, except for that part. I hope it gets better as I get more time with it.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra few dollars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to pay a lot but went ahead and spent a little more and bought this shaver. WELL worth it. Shaves close and fast and easy on the skin. So far I have found to faults with it and been using it for around a month.
customer_reviews.author: morris bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Wildly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this razor. For the money, I expected a LOT more. The shave I got was mediocre at best and I had to go back over my neck with a regular razor to get all the hairs it missed. I'm going to have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Henry

customer_reviews.title: Will never use a different shaver
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Gets as close as you can get to a straight razor if not the exact same closeness. It has a cleaning mode which is awesome for keeping it clean and smelling nice. The ability to use it in the shower makes it a game changer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Not Your Average Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has used an electric razor for the last 40 years. He was skeptical at first because it’s such a lightweight shaver. After it’s first use, he was sold! Says it’s much smoother than his last Braun!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Could be better made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to replace two Phillips razors that I can no longer get blades for, one for travel, one for home. They shave great, but the display on the one I use at home went nuts. All the LEDS illuminate, thus you cannot tell what percent charge is. I've only had them about 6 months, and I just ordered a new one to replace the one that is messed up. I hope that it lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: too old to care

customer_reviews.title: A quality product
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Panasonic electric razor I have had for 15 yrs. It will cut a wet or dry beard. I find that if I moisten my face with a slightly wet wash cloth it cuts better especially if I dont shave for 3 or 4 days. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've ever owned!!!  And I've owned a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I've been through numerous electric razors over the year, high end razors, to include Braun and Norelco. This by far leads the way for closest shave. I love it! Also, I wouldn't waste my money on the self cleaning one (I was strongly considering), but I read another reviewer who said how easy it is to clean, and I agree. Just simply take off the grill, rub a little soap on it with your finger, rinse off, set on stand to dry until next usage. Also, I like that it tells you how low the battery is getting so that you know when to recharge it (many other razors do not have this feature)
customer_reviews.author: DETJ

product_meta.title: Panasonic Electric Shaver and Trimmer for Men, ES8243A ARC4, Wet/Dry with 4 Blades and Flexible Pivoting Head
product_meta.description: Style Name:Orange LCD ES8243AOne of Panasonic’s top rated electric shavers, the ES8242A men’s shaver delivers close, clean, quick shaving with four ultra-sharp stainless steel Nanotech blades. Each blade in the Panasonic ES8243A Arc 4 mens electric razor is precision honed to a perfect 30° edge. Together with Panasonic's ultra-thin Arc 4 foil system, they gently conform to the individual contours of your face, neck and chin. This premium men's shaving machine also includes a flexible pivoting head to guide blades and foil effortlessly along the skin for maximum comfort. Its high-efficiency 13,000 cpm Arc4 linear drive motor maintains full, continuous power to the very end of each battery charge for consistent, even shaving. The Panasonic razor also includes a built-in pop-up trimmer which adds the perfect finish to beards, mustaches and sideburns. It's 100% waterproof, too, and can be used with foam or gel in the shower or used dry anytime. A 10-stage LED in the easy-grip Panasonic Shaver handle shows battery power status, charge indicator and a cleaning and a replacement reminder for Panasonic Arc 4 blades and foils. Cleaning the ES8243 shaver is quick and simple. You can rinse the entire shaving machine under running water and let the razor's sonic vibration mode easily remove stubborn gel and stubble, leaving the Arc4 blades and foil fresh and renewed. For shaving and grooming away from home, this Panasonic Arc4 men's wet dry electric shaver comes with universal voltage, an AC adaptor/charger and a travel pouch.
feature_bullets: Sharp Men’s Shaver Blades: Panasonic ARC4 men's electric shaver with four ultra sharp precision honed 30° Nanotech blades and ultra thin ARC foil follow facial contours for a quick, close and comfortable shave. The charging time is 1 hour and the shaves per charge (3min/1 shave) is approximately 14 shaves
Wet/Dry Electric Shaver and Trimmer 2 in 1: Built in pop up trimmer details mustaches, beards and sideburns; Wet/dry waterproof shaver allows for convenient shaving in or out of the shower

Flexible Pivoting Head: Panasonic flexible pivoting electric shaver head glides effortlessly to trace the individual contours of face, chin, neck and jaw; Built in shaving sensor monitors differences in beard density and automatically adjusts cutting power for exceptional comfort
High performance Motor with a Linear Drive: This Panasonic shaver is equipped with a linear motor which delivers 13,000 cuts per minute and maintains peak power up to the end of every battery charge

LCD Battery Indicator: The shaver’s 10 stage LCD shows battery status at a glance; Rechargeable, portable and travel friendly. Power source 100 to 240 volt ac, 50 to 60 hertz. Motor voltage is 3.6 volt dc. Charging time is 1 hour

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
